intro: Goniothalamus sericeus, commonly known as the silky goniothalamus, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
